channel.title: NationBuilder Customer Stories
channel.description: Case studies of parties, nonprofits, advocacy groups and more who've showed us powerful ways to lead.

item.title: How party on the rise PTB-PVDA gained 35 seats in Belgian parliament
item.description: The Workers’ party of Belgium (PTB-PVDA) launched highly targeted phone banking campaigns to get out the vote in local and national elections and become one of the top five parties in Belgium.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: How political outsider Andrew Yang grew his base and qualified for the 2019 debates
item.description: This Democratic challenger made the transition from internet meme to grassroots movement and drove early fundraising success by mobilizing his committed fan base, the Yang Gang.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: Unite America built a networked infrastructure for independent candidates in U.S. elections
item.description: What began as an idea in 2013 has become a full-fledged movement to disrupt the two-party system in the U.S.—supporting thirty endorsed independent candidates across nine states in the 2018 midterms.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: We Are Sikhs organizes to tell the American Sikh community's story
item.description: An idea-turned-initiative is leveraging powerful storytelling to break down misperceptions of the Sikh community in the United States.
item.author: Nelli Veletyan

item.title: Kerryn Phelps won the Wentworth seat in a historic by-election
item.description: A nationally-renowned doctor and marriage equality advocate ran as an independent and won a parliamentary seat held by Australia’s Liberal party for the last century.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: The Marriage Equality campaign inspired Australians to get out the vote and say "Yes"
item.description: The Australian Marriage Equality campaign engaged millions of citizens through powerful storytelling to participate in an optional vote affirming the rights of same-sex couples—many participating in a political campaign for the first time.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: How European Greens created a network for change-makers
item.description: With a “green wave” moving through Europe, Tilt! serves as a single platform to rally grassroots support for progressive and environmental causes across the continent.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: Groen makes history in Belgian elections
item.description: In the span of one year, Groen built best-in-class websites and infrastructure for hundreds of cities and thousands of candidates, using grassroots organizing to engage more green party voters in Belgium than ever before.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: University of California turns students into voters, and voters into advocates
item.description: UCLA’s innovative pilot program allows students to proactively join the UC advocacy organization while they register to vote, reducing the barriers for participation and leading to exponential growth in advocate engagement across campus.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: VolunteerCleanup.org connects South Florida citizens to protect beaches and waterways
item.description: An eco-conscious Miami couple went from clearing marine debris in their spare time to running Miami-Dade County’s go-to online event hub for beach cleanup projects.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: People's Vote spreads a powerful civic movement throughout the U.K.
item.description: With record-breaking demonstrations and mass outreach to Members of Parliament, a grassroots coalition continues to amplify the public demand for a People’s Vote on Brexit and gain traction within the U.K. government.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: LivableStreets Alliance accelerates transportation solutions in Boston
item.description: Learn how a five-person advocacy team moved three successful initiatives forward and helped drive a $5 million increase to Boston’s transportation budget.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: How Voters Not Politicians mobilized to end gerrymandering in Michigan
item.description: A nonpartisan organization of volunteers rallied an army of Michiganders to campaign for Prop 2, a statewide ballot initiative to end gerrymandering, and won 61% of the vote.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: AllSaints strengthens customer relationships, one email at a time
item.description: AllSaints harnessed NationBuilder to find a collaborative solution to a challenge all high-end brands face: how do you build mass email campaigns as expertly targeted as they are beautiful?
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: Maryland GOP created a network model for a whole party to follow
item.description: The Maryland GOP built a scalable network with an innovative cost-sharing structure to both reduce barriers to entry for new candidates and share valuable data with their larger party.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: How NYC Votes boosted civic engagement for local elections
item.description: The New York Campaign Finance Board used an inquisitive, data-driven approach to inform, engage, register, and drive voters to participate in the important election for NYC mayor.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: Apex Clean Energy forges a path for wind farms around the US & Canada
item.description: Apex Clean Energy is leveraging a powerful network and strategic digital outreach to advocate for renewable energy—overcoming organized opposition and paving the way for a growing number of successful wind projects.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: Randall Woodfin beat a 7-year incumbent & became one of Birmingham's youngest mayors
item.description: With a fresh approach to politics and strong grassroots support from his community, Randall Woodfin inspired thousands of young people to vote for the first time in a municipal election.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: Lone Star Veterans Association harnessed community for hurricane relief
item.description: A veterans affinity group used NationBuilder to turn a post-Harvey text outreach into a full-scale search, rescue, and relief effort for the Houston community they’d served for years.
item.author: Jane St. John

item.title: How Jacinda Ardern became New Zealand's youngest female prime minister
item.description: The New Zealand Labour party paired a strong digital infrastructure with a resounding message to beat their fundraising goals and rally a nation around their new leader.
item.author: Jane St. John
